description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8qm5s","text":"This is a slightly modified and simplified version of a protocol by Thomas G.W. Graham et al, which is available at https://gitlab.com/tjian-darzacq-lab/bearmix and has been described in depth in the article 10.1371/journal.pone.0246647, for the recombinant expression of a E602D mutant of Taq DNA polymerase in pET-28a that is available in Addgene (Addgene plasmid # 166944 ; http://n2t.net/addgene:166944 ; RRID:Addgene_166944).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":208,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":116,"length":44},{"key":1,"offset":208,"length":28},{"key":2,"offset":377,"length":29}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ugku","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c67s","text":"The main goal of this protocol is to eliminate the use of large volumes for dialysis and potential issues with the protein crashing out of the solution due to the use of concentrators for buffer exchange of this enzyme into storage conditions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"0325CB1E2C2111EC8E6C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://gitlab.com/tjian-darzacq-lab/bearmix"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"EEBF75252C2011EC8E6C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://dx.doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0246647"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"343C800A2C2111EC8E6C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://n2t.net/addgene:166944"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"648e","text":"Use the full volume of the preinoculum to inoculate   of LB (or TB) media supplemented with  Kan (1% inoculation). Grow at   until reaching an optical density at 600 nm (OD600) = 0.8.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":172,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":52,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":92,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":123,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","guid":"D49FBB10AA8D11EAAC59BD9017E1E6B6","id":"84704","label":"","unit":3}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"0.05","error_concentration":false,"guid":"E98AAA54AA8D11EA8AF20A58A9FEAC2A","id":"8042","label":"","unit":204}},"2":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"","data":{"duration":0,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B2167FA016EA11ECBF5D29663ADCDBE3","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"160","start":null,"temperature":"37","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"66u08","text":"Upon reaching OD600 = 0.8,  add IPTG to a final concentration of   and incubate  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":16,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":80,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"0.5","guid":"F1C74DB0AA8E11EAAC59BD9017E1E6B6","id":"8043","label":"","unit":28}},"1":{"type":"shaker","mutability":"","data":{"duration":7200,"error_shaker":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"C43F16B016EA11ECBF5D29663ADCDBE3","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"shaker":false,"temperature":false},"shaker":"160","start":null,"temperature":"37","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dtp5m","text":"Centrifuge the cell culture  .Then, resuspend the cell pellet in   of Buffer A freshly supplemented with   PMSF and   lysozyme.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":65,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":105,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":116,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"4000","duration":1200,"guid":"752AB5C0AA8F11EAAC59BD9017E1E6B6","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"8BF18D10AA8F11EAAC59BD9017E1E6B6","id":"84705","label":"","unit":2}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"1.0","guid":"4D9CC470AA9511EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"8044","label":"","unit":28}},"3":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"0.2","guid":"94387B40AA9511EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"8045","label":"","unit":204}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23uft","text":"Sonicate on ice for   using cycles of   ON and   OFF at 40% amplitude (Qsonica Q125, 125W).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":20,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":38,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":47,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":480,"guid":"A1E9CAEBAA9511EA8AF20A58A9FEAC2A","id":"77414","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1,"guid":"B165A8A0AA9511EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"77415","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":6,"guid":"BB0BE770AA9511EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"77416","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fu9lo","text":"On an ultracentrifugation tube, incubate the unclarified lysate at   for   to precipitate most of E. coli proteins, and then place on ice for  . Centrifuge   and collect the supernatant. You might want to collect a small sample for SDS-PAGE afterwards.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":98,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":73,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":142,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":156,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"EDEDDFE0AA9511EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"46997","label":"","temperature":"75","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"F501DB10AA9511EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"77417","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"132FBA20AA9711EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"77418","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"20000","duration":1200,"guid":"25F358B0AA9711EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4n3fg","text":"On a 1 mL HisTrap column (GE Healthcare) pre-equilibrated with 10 column volumes (c.v.) (here, 10 mL) of Buffer A, load the supernant. Wash with 10-20 c.v. of Buffer B. Repeat the wash step with Buffer C. Then, elute with 5 c.v. of Buffer D, collecting the eluted fractions every  in 1.5 ml tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":5,"length":35},{"style":"bold","offset":105,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":159,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":195,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":232,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":280,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"0.5","error":false,"guid":"17CBBB00AA9811EAB804652ADB7AA5E5","id":"84706","label":"","unit":2}}}}

steps.section: DAY 4B – Second purification and buffer exchange by Heparin
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cv7g","text":"This method was preferred over protein dyalisis or Amicon protein concentration to avoid using large buffer volumes and proteins crashing out of the solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4mmde","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"318qg","text":"Dilute the pooled fractions 6X in buffer containing 50 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0 and 100 mM NaCl.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DAY 4B – Second purification and buffer exchange by Heparin
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3coap","text":"For storage, supplement your pooled fractions with   Tris-HCl pH 8.0,   EDTA and   DTT. Then, dilute the sample by adding glycerol up to   to reach final storage conditions: 50 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0, ~100 mM NaCl, 0.1 mM EDTA, 3 mM DTT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":174,"length":59}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":51,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":70,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":81,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":137,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"100","error_concentration":false,"guid":"7D301E6F16ED11EC8B1A0A58A9FEAC02","id":"8046","label":"","unit":28}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"0.2","guid":"8AABE990EE2E11EABA5CE96E1CB56916","id":"8046","label":"","unit":28}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"6","error_concentration":false,"guid":"A31E06CF16ED11EC8B1A0A58A9FEAC02","id":"8046","label":"","unit":28}},"3":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"50","guid":"A88116C0EE2E11EABA5CE96E1CB56916","id":"8049","label":"","unit":14}}}}

steps.section: DAY 4B – Second purification and buffer exchange by Heparin
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"20bcb","text":"Generate   aliquots of the enzyme and store it at   until required.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"200","guid":"C1489250EE2911EAA93113ECFEAC4F16","id":"84712","label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"CD079F00EE2911EAA93113ECFEAC4F16","id":"46998","label":"","temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"572mf","text":"To quickly pool the fractions containing the protein of interest, prepare a 96-well plate or 1.5 mL tubes with  of 5X Bradford reagent and  of distilled water. Then, add  of each protein fraction and compare against a blank reference sample corresponding to  of Buffer C. You can determine your protein-containing fractions either by absorbance at 595 nm on a plate reader or visually by comparing the blue coloration of each fraction against the blank reference. Pool your fractions and collect a   sample for SDS-PAGE.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":262,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":111,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":139,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":170,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":258,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":498,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"40","guid":"42A7E04616EC11EC8B1A0A58A9FEAC02","id":"84707","label":"","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"150","error":false,"guid":"42A7E0B516EC11EC8B1A0A58A9FEAC02","id":"84708","label":"","unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","guid":"42A7E21C16EC11EC8B1A0A58A9FEAC02","id":"84709","label":"","unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","guid":"42A7E2CD16EC11EC8B1A0A58A9FEAC02","id":"84710","label":"","unit":1}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","guid":"42A7DEB416EC11EC8B1A0A58A9FEAC02","id":"84711","label":"","unit":1}}}}

steps.section: DAY 4B – Second purification and buffer exchange by Heparin
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1g1r0","text":"Next, load the diluted sample onto a 1 ml HiTrap Heparin column previously equilibrated with 10 c.v. (here, 10 mL) Buffer HA. Then, elute the protein using a 10 c.v. linear gradient against Buffer HB, collecting the eluted fractions every  in 1.5 ml tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":37,"length":26},{"style":"bold","offset":115,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":190,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":239,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dic08","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96ddj","text":"This linear gradient can be achieved by connecting two containers, one with 5 c.v. Buffer HA and the other with 5 c.v. buffer HB, with a syphon or a tube, and withdrawing solution from the Buffer HA container to the column using a cheap peristaltic pump or by gravity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"0.5","error":false,"guid":"F2BD6AA316EC11EC8B1A0A58A9FEAC02","id":"84706","label":"","unit":2}}}}

steps.section: DAY 4B – Second purification and buffer exchange by Heparin
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cfqgd","text":"Again, determine your protein-containing fractions using the Bradford assay. Pool your fractions and determine its protein concentration using the same method and collect a   sample for SDS-PAGE.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":173,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"10","guid":"39A68F8716ED11EC8B1A0A58A9FEAC02","id":"84711","label":"","unit":1}}}}
